definitions.definition: To move (one object) while maintaining contact with another object over some area, with pressure and friction.
examples: I rubbed the cloth over the glass.
The cat rubbed itself against my leg.
I rubbed my hands together for warmth.
My shoes are beginning to rub .

definitions.definition: To spread a substance thinly over; to smear.
examples: meat rubbed with spices before barbecuing

definitions.definition: To move or pass with difficulty.
examples: to rub through woods, as huntsmen

definitions.definition: To scour; to burnish; to polish; to brighten; to cleanse; often with up or over .
To hinder; to cross; to thwart.
To touch the jack with the bowl .

main_definition: ( transitive ) To move (one object) while maintaining contact with another object over some area, with pressure and friction.
secondary_definitions: ( intransitive ) To be rubbed against something.
( transitive ) To spread a substance thinly over; to smear.
( dated ) To move or pass with difficulty.
To scour; to burnish; to polish; to brighten; to cleanse; often with up or over .
To hinder; to cross; to thwart.
( transitive , bowls ) To touch the jack with the bowl .
